strapiPost.title: Tontitown Grape Festival
strapiPost.content:
Who knew celebrating grapes could be so fun? The Tontitown Grape Festival is back for 122nd year, and it's all about tradition.

  • Stomping grounds: With live music, carnivals, and some good old-fashioned grape stomping, this annual festival celebrates Tontitown's rich, Italian history. The celebration will be from Aug. 3-7.
  • There's more: Throughout the week, you can also get a taste of authentic Italian cuisine with spaghetti dinners served every night, join the fun run, or enjoy live entertainment.

Find out more about the festival and its history HERE.
